title: >>> Daredevil DASH
body_text:
AVAKIAN versus LONDONO: Part 2
The magic that was DODGEBALL 96, recreated, relived ten events later. It's just one of those things than can spark so much electricity, perhaps best described as
unforgettable
.
Like their previous engagement, team generals Rob Avakian and Juan Londono proved to the world they possess all of the necessary tools and capabilities in becoming two of the all-time greats. These "daredevils" stop at nothing, giving a 100% performance, lighting a flame under the asses of their allies.
Season 1 superpower Chris Adams, the seemingly unstoppable, soon-to-be season finale headliner Mike Butler, the speedy "catch me if you can" prodigy Rob Pellecchia, combined with the never-say-die attitute and non-stop effort of the captains themselves yielded yet another spectacular event from beginning to end.
And if the ultra-intense competition wasn't enough, the hilarious "study hall" moment featuring Kristen Driscoll and "woman killer" Kevin Megill would have sent anyone home with a glowing smile.
Results by Game
Avakian: 2, 3, 8, 11
Londono: 1, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 12
A "magical" win for the Colombian "Cockroach" Londono. His ever-resilient, gutsy performance lead to his defeat of the mighty Rob Avakian, 8 to 4, at DODGEBALL 106. This ties their historic series at 1 apiece. It's safe to say a third, and likely final contest will put an end to this brutal war.
Moments & Stars
: Mike Butler taking down every member of Team AVAKIAN to win Game 6; Kristen Driscoll and John Tronolone relaxing on court in a camping chair; the consequence for sitting in camping chair while a game is in progress; the comical double elimination on Rob Avakian and Mike "Sputz" just moments after the infamous Driscoll/Megill incident; the "previews" between CX headliners Kerr/Krott and Bertsch/Butler
109, CX Announcements!
Can you say
insane
!? That's just one choice word to describe the unbelievably phenomenal match-ups in store for the conclusion of this unreal 11th Season!
First, a battle between brains and braun of the sport when wily veteran
Ryan Letsche
takes on rookie sensation
Justin Wolf
at
DODGEBALL 109
on October 27!
Then on the grandest stage of all,
DODGEBALL CX
, it will be a never-before-seen clash of couples! The beloved yet destructive combo of
Alison Bertsch
and
Mike Butler
will collide with the dominant twosome of
Melissa Kerr
and
Mike "Sputz" Krott
! The most unexpected, shocking encounter in all of dodgeball history! Catch the drama, experience the excitement, feel the electricity of this blockbuster on November 3!
RECORDS
> Attendance: 20
> Notable Returns: Travis Mills (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXXXVI); Nate Miernik (Last appearance at DODGEBALL NINETY 4)
> New Players: (2) Tom Hogarty, Blake Tedeschi
- It has been 15 events since the last
Wet War
. DODGEBALL 91, also known as the
CREAMation 2
was the last of these slippery events dating back to mid-June 2007.
- Juan Londono became only the 5th competitor to reach four wins as captain, earning a record of 4-2-0. Rob Avakian unfortunately suffered his second loss of three total matches, now with a record of 1-2-0.
- Participants and spectators of DODGEBALL 106 were treated to some delicious free pizza thanks to Luke, trays of snacks by Alison Bertsch, and a bag full of Starbucks goodies thanks to Bob Cornero.
________________________________________
____________
WALL v. ALL: The Final Chapter
Can
WALL
close the casket for good?
Will
ALL
breathe after all is said and done?
Plus, the results are in! Which did the warriors choose in the DODGEBALL 108
Secret Selection
? Find out live this Saturday night at DODGEBALL CVII.
...........
Join the
Dodgeball TML
!
Mailing lists, emailing lists, Facebook invites, and now the
TextMessaging List
! Diehard veterans of yesterday and today will receive up to date news and headlines regarding the weekly extravanganzas! From matches not yet announced to sidelining injuries, added stipulations, website news, and more! So if you get a text message from
ECDodgeball
, best be sure to check it out! This is your ticket to stay current on all of the happenings on and off the court!
*Standard text messaging rates apply. Contact John Tronolone or send a text message back to ECDodgeball to cancel.
body_html:
AVAKIAN versus LONDONO: Part 2
The magic that was DODGEBALL 96, recreated, relived ten events later. It's just one of those things than can spark so much electricity, perhaps best described as unforgettable.

Like their previous engagement, team generals Rob Avakian and Juan Londono proved to the world they possess all of the necessary tools and capabilities in becoming two of the all-time greats. These "daredevils" stop at nothing, giving a 100% performance, lighting a flame under the asses of their allies.

Season 1 superpower Chris Adams, the seemingly unstoppable, soon-to-be season finale headliner Mike Butler, the speedy "catch me if you can" prodigy Rob Pellecchia, combined with the never-say-die attitute and non-stop effort of the captains themselves yielded yet another spectacular event from beginning to end.

And if the ultra-intense competition wasn't enough, the hilarious "study hall" moment featuring Kristen Driscoll and "woman killer" Kevin Megill would have sent anyone home with a glowing smile.

Results by Game
Avakian: 2, 3, 8, 11
Londono: 1, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 12

A "magical" win for the Colombian "Cockroach" Londono. His ever-resilient, gutsy performance lead to his defeat of the mighty Rob Avakian, 8 to 4, at DODGEBALL 106. This ties their historic series at 1 apiece. It's safe to say a third, and likely final contest will put an end to this brutal war.

Moments & Stars: Mike Butler taking down every member of Team AVAKIAN to win Game 6; Kristen Driscoll and John Tronolone relaxing on court in a camping chair; the consequence for sitting in camping chair while a game is in progress; the comical double elimination on Rob Avakian and Mike "Sputz" just moments after the infamous Driscoll/Megill incident; the "previews" between CX headliners Kerr/Krott and Bertsch/Butler

109, CX Announcements!
Can you say insane!? That's just one choice word to describe the unbelievably phenomenal match-ups in store for the conclusion of this unreal 11th Season!

First, a battle between brains and braun of the sport when wily veteran Ryan Letsche takes on rookie sensation Justin Wolf at DODGEBALL 109 on October 27!

Then on the grandest stage of all, DODGEBALL CX, it will be a never-before-seen clash of couples! The beloved yet destructive combo of Alison Bertsch and Mike Butler will collide with the dominant twosome of Melissa Kerr and Mike "Sputz" Krott! The most unexpected, shocking encounter in all of dodgeball history! Catch the drama, experience the excitement, feel the electricity of this blockbuster on November 3!

RECORDS
> Attendance: 20
> Notable Returns: Travis Mills (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXXXVI); Nate Miernik (Last appearance at DODGEBALL NINETY 4)
> New Players: (2) Tom Hogarty, Blake Tedeschi

- It has been 15 events since the last Wet War. DODGEBALL 91, also known as the CREAMation 2 was the last of these slippery events dating back to mid-June 2007.
- Juan Londono became only the 5th competitor to reach four wins as captain, earning a record of 4-2-0. Rob Avakian unfortunately suffered his second loss of three total matches, now with a record of 1-2-0.
- Participants and spectators of DODGEBALL 106 were treated to some delicious free pizza thanks to Luke, trays of snacks by Alison Bertsch, and a bag full of Starbucks goodies thanks to Bob Cornero.
____________________________________________________



WALL v. ALL: The Final Chapter
Can WALL close the casket for good?
Will ALL breathe after all is said and done?

Plus, the results are in! Which did the warriors choose in the DODGEBALL 108 Secret Selection? Find out live this Saturday night at DODGEBALL CVII.


...........


Join the Dodgeball TML!
Mailing lists, emailing lists, Facebook invites, and now the TextMessaging List! Diehard veterans of yesterday and today will receive up to date news and headlines regarding the weekly extravanganzas! From matches not yet announced to sidelining injuries, added stipulations, website news, and more! So if you get a text message from ECDodgeball, best be sure to check it out! This is your ticket to stay current on all of the happenings on and off the court!

*Standard text messaging rates apply. Contact John Tronolone or send a text message back to ECDodgeball to cancel.
